xxl.core.indexStructures
Class BPlusTree.NodeConverter

java.lang.Object
  xxl.core.io.converters.Converter
      xxl.core.indexStructures.BPlusTree.NodeConverter
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
Direct Known Subclasses:
HilbertRTree.NodeConverter, MVBTree.NodeConverter
Enclosing class:
BPlusTree
public class BPlusTree.NodeConverter
extends Converter

A NodeConverter is used by the BPlusTree to convert the Nodes for I/O-purposes.

See Also:

readEntries

protected void readEntries(java.io.DataInput input,
                           BPlusTree.Node node,
                           int number)
                    throws java.io.IOException
Read the entries of the given Node from the DataInput. If the Node is a leaf the dataConverter is used to read its data objects. Otherwise the method readIndexEntry(DataInput, int)is used to read its IndexEntries.

Parameters:
input - the DataInput
node - the Node
number - the number of the entries which have to be read
Throws:
java.io.IOException

writeEntries

protected void writeEntries(java.io.DataOutput output,
                            BPlusTree.Node node)
                     throws java.io.IOException
Writes the entries of the given Node into the DataOutput. If the Node is a leaf the dataConverter is used to write its data objects. Otherwise the method writeIndexEntry(DataOutput, BPlusTree.IndexEntry) is used to write its IndexEntries.

Parameters:
output - the DataOutput
node - the Node
Throws:
java.io.IOException

indexEntrySize

protected int indexEntrySize()
Computes the maximal size (in bytes) of an IndexEntry. It calls the method getIdSize() of the tree container. If the tree container has not been initialized a NullPointerException is thrown.

Returns:
the maximal size of an IndexEntry

leafEntrySize

protected int leafEntrySize()

headerSize

protected int headerSize()
Computes the size (in bytes) of the Node's header which contains some information such as level and entries number.

Returns:
the maximal size of an IndexEntry

readIndexEntry

protected BPlusTree.IndexEntry readIndexEntry(java.io.DataInput input,
                                              int parentLevel)
                                       throws java.io.IOException
Reads an IndexEntry from the given DataInput. In the default implementation only the ID of the IndexEntry is read.

Parameters:
input - the DataInput
parentLevel - the parent level of the IndexEntry
Returns:
the read IndexEntry
Throws:
java.io.IOException

writeIndexEntry

protected void writeIndexEntry(java.io.DataOutput output,
                               BPlusTree.IndexEntry entry)
                        throws java.io.IOException
Writes an IndexEntry into the given DataOutput. In the default implementation only the ID of the IndexEntry is written.

Parameters:
output - the DataOutput
entry - the IndexEntry which has to be written
Throws:
java.io.IOException
